intro: Tetramerium rubrum, commonly known as the red-stemmed tetramerium, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, reddish stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small, clustered in inflorescences, and typically have five petals. Tetramerium rubrum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
